Peter Brandt says Bitcoin a ‘hop, skip and jump’ from $42k

12h ago//Ann Maria Shibu
bitcoinregulation
AI

Summary

TH

นักเทรดผู้เชี่ยวชาญอย่าง Peter Brandt คาดการณ์ว่า Bitcoin กำลังเข้าใกล้แนวรับด้านล่างที่สำคัญในระดับราคาประมาณ $42,000 เขาอ้างอิงข้อมูลในอดีตและรูปแบบกราฟระยะยาวที่เขาเรียกว่า 'banana peel' support zone ซึ่งในอดีตมักทำหน้าที่เป็นเส้นชี้ชีวิตที่จำกัดการร่วงลงของราคา Bitcoin ในภาวะตลาดหมี ทำให้เขาเชื่อว่าการปรับตัวลงในครั้งนี้น่าจะมีขอบเขตไม่ไกลจากจุดนี้ นอกจากนี้ Brandt ยังได้ชี้ให้เห็นว่าการเคลื่อนไหวของราคาล่าสุดเป็นผลมาจาก 'campaign selling' หรือการขายขนาดใหญ่ที่เป็นระบบของผู้ถือหลัก มากกว่าการขายตัดขาดของนักลงทุนรายย่อย แม้ตลาด Crypto จะเผชิญกับแรงขายหนัก แต่แนวรับในประวัติศาสตร์บ่งชี้ว่าราคาอาจใกล้จะสิ้นสุดการดิ่งลงแล้ว

EN

Veteran trader Peter Brandt suggests Bitcoin is approaching a potential downside floor near the $42,000 level. He cites historical data and a specific long-term chart pattern he calls the 'banana peel' support zone, which has historically contained Bitcoin’s deepest drawdowns. Brandt believes that if Bitcoin reaches this depth, the downside may be limited and bulls could find relief soon. Additionally, Brandt noted that the recent price action reflects 'campaign selling' by large entities rather than retail liquidation. While the market is under sustained selling pressure, he maintains that the historical support boundary suggests the current decline may be reaching its limits.

Key Points

  • Peter Brandt identifies $42,000 as a key support level for Bitcoin based on historical 'banana peel' patterns.
  • The trader suggests the current downside is limited and Bitcoin is a 'hop, skip and jump' from the floor.
  • Recent price action is attributed to 'campaign selling' by large entities rather than retail panic.
  • Broader crypto market is experiencing a downturn, but historical data indicates potential containment of losses.

Article

Veteran trader Peter Brandt said Bitcoin could be approaching a potential downside floor, arguing that past bear market patterns suggest losses may be limited from current levels. Summary Veteran trader Peter Brandt said Bitcoin may be nearing a downside floor, pointing to past bear market cycles that suggest losses could be limited near the $42,000 level. Brandt referenced a long-term “banana peel” support zone on his chart, which has historically marked areas where Bitcoin’s deepest drawdowns struggled to extend further. The comments come amid a broader crypto market downturn, with Bitcoin and major altcoins under sustained selling pressure. “If Bitcoin digs into the banana peel as deeply as in past bear market cycles, then the bulls should not need to suffer too far south of $42,000,” Brandt wrote on X. “We are a hop, skip and jump from there.” Brandt accompanied the post with a long-term Bitcoin ( BTC ) chart showing price action relative to what he describes as a “banana peel” support zone, a curved lower boundary that has historically contained Bitcoin’s deepest drawdowns . Bitcoin long-term price action and ‘banana peel’ support zone | Source: Peter Brandt Brandt’s “banana peel” metaphor refers to the slippery downside zone, where price can slide quickly but has historically struggled to sustain deep breaks below it. In the current cycle, that lower boundary sits near the $42,000 level, implying Bitcoin may be nearing a historically significant area of support. Brandt flags Bitcoin ‘campaign selling’ in prior warning Brandt’s latest post follows a separate tweet from the previous day, in which he said Bitcoin’s recent price action appeared to reflect “campaign selling” rather than retail-driven capitulation. In that earlier post, Brandt pointed to a multi-day pattern of lower highs and lower lows, suggesting that large, coordinated sellers may be driving the decline. He added that similar patterns have appeared in past market cycles, though timing a bottom remains uncertain. Hey crypto followers $BTC The nature of the decline in Bitcoin (now 8 days of lower lows and highs) has all the finger prints of campaign selling, not retail liquidation Seen this before hundreds of times over the decades Never know when of course this pattern ends Note to trolls… pic.twitter.com/THGJpez35F — Peter Brandt (@PeterLBrandt) February 5, 2026 Together, the two tweets frame a cautious outlook: further downside may be possible, but historical behavior could limit how far prices fall. The comments come as Bitcoin continues to slide alongside a broader crypto market downturn, with prices under pressure across major digital assets. Major altcoins have followed Bitcoin lower, amplifying losses across the sector.
